com.zebra.sdk.common.card.graphics.barcode

Interface BarcodeUtil

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Code128Util, Code39Util, CodeCodabarUtil, CodeDataMatrixUtil, CodeEAN128Util, CodeEANUtil, CodeInterleaved2Of5Util, CodePDF417Util, CodePostnetUtil, CodeQRUtil

    public interface BarcodeUtil
    Base interface used for drawing a barcode.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void doQuietZone(boolean value)

    • Method Detail

      • drawBarcode

        void drawBarcode(String data,
               int x,
               int y,
               Rotation rotation)
        Draws the selected barcode symbology at the user specified x and y coordinates.
        Parameters:
        data - Data to encode.
        x - The x coordinate.
        y - The y coordinate.
        rotation - The orientation of the barcode.

      • doQuietZone

        void doQuietZone(boolean value)
        Controls whether a quiet zone should be included or not.
        Parameters:
        value - True to include a quite zone.

      • setBarHeight

        void setBarHeight(double height)
        Sets the height of the bars.
        Parameters:
        height - The height of the bars (in pixels).

      • setFont

        void setFont(Font font)
        Sets the font of the human-readable portion.
        Parameters:
        font - The font.

      • setHeight

        void setHeight(double height)
        Sets the full height of the barcode including the human-readable portion.
        Parameters:
        height - The full height (in pixels).

      • setModuleWidth

        void setModuleWidth(double width)
        Sets the width of the narrow module.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the narrow module (in pixels).

      • setMessagePosition

        void setMessagePosition(HumanReadablePlacement placement)
        Sets the placement of the human-readable part.
        Parameters:
        placement - The placement of the human-readable part.

      • setQuietZoneWidth

        void setQuietZoneWidth(double width)
        Sets the width of the quiet zone.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the quiet zone (in pixels).

      • setVerticalQuietZone

        void setVerticalQuietZone(double height)
        Sets the height of the vertical quiet zone.
        • If this value is not explicitly set the vertical quiet zone has the same width as the horizontal quiet zone.
        Parameters:
        height - The height of the vertical quiet zone (in pixels).

      • getBarHeight

        double getBarHeight()
        Returns the height of the bars.
        Returns:
        The height of the bars (in pixels).

      • getFont

        Font getFont()
        Returns the font of the human-readable portion.
        Returns:
        The font.

      • getHeight

        double getHeight()
        Returns the full height of the barcode.
        Returns:
        The full height (in pixels).

      • getModuleWidth

        double getModuleWidth()
        Returns the width of the narrow module.
        Returns:
        The width of the narrow module (in pixels).

      • getQuietZoneWidth

        double getQuietZoneWidth()
        Returns the width of the quiet zone.
        Returns:
        The width of the quiet zone (in pixels).

      • getVerticalQuietZone

        double getVerticalQuietZone()
        Returns the vertical quiet zone.
        • If no vertical quiet zone is set explicitly, the value if getQuietZone() is returned.
        Returns:
        The height of the vertical quiet zone (in pixels).

      • setPattern

        void setPattern(String pattern)
        Sets the pattern to be applied over the human readable message.
        Parameters:
        pattern - The pattern to be applied over the human readable message.

      • getPattern

        String getPattern()
        Returns the pattern to be applied over the human readable message.
        Returns:
        The pattern to be applied over the human readable message.

      • hasQuietZone

        boolean hasQuietZone()
        Indicates whether a quiet zone is included.
        Returns:
        True if a quiet zone is included.

      • getBarWidth

        double getBarWidth(int width)
        Returns the effective width of a bar with a given logical width.
        Parameters:
        width - The logical width (1=narrow, 2=wide).
        Returns:
        The effective width of a bar (in pixels).
